TEXT.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
TEXT.source: ['13. to ko rana ngaro', '我要離婚', 'I want a divorce', '', 'si apen Manidong (F, 54, Iranmilek)', '黃堅里，女，54，東清村', '']

S.FORM: ra-roa sira ori a mi-aven do vahay,
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個是夫妻
They are a couple.

S.FORM: mi sia mang-hap so keytan do Likeyaevek am, ikongodo mi-開開玩笑 sira ori, ta 年青人 sira ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他們去Likeyaevek挖山芋。因為他們都是年輕人，所以喜歡開玩笑
They went to Likeyaevek to dig up mountain taro. They loved to joke because they were so young.

S.FORM: mehakay ori am, to mang-hap so veysen a, ma-ngay do ma-ngali so keytan a mavakes na ori a, teyka rana sira ori a ni-man-zavok.
S.TRANSL: 他們除好田草以後；先生就拿了小石子到正在挖山芋的太太那裡去
Once they finished pulling out the weeds, the wife started to dig out taro. The husband took some stones and went to his wife.

S.FORM: “pa-telem-en ko pala jimo ya, ala ma-nao ko imo no veysen ya an?”
S.TRANSL: 他說“我用這個石頭丟你看看，會不會丟中你？”
“I’ll throw these stones at you and see if I can hit you,” the husband said.

S.FORM: to na pa-tel-telém-a ori, am ji na a-nao ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他就對她連續丟擲了石頭，可是都沒有丟中她
He kept throwing stones at her but didn’t hit her.

S.FORM: “akmi mi-zo-z-óm-iak a, ha ”koan na no mavakes a. to na pa-telém-a, to na pa-telém-a,
S.TRANSL: “像神經病一樣，喝 ”他太太說。他丟不中，就一直丟她石頭
“You’re like idiots!” his wife said. He continued to throw stones at her.

S.FORM: ipí-sa na so ka-pa-telem na sia am, koan na am, i-pi-ci-cinoza na rana no rala na ori a.
S.TRANSL: 有一次，女的嘀咕的唸著“（聽不清楚女的罵什麼話）” ，就在這時候，她的頭被擊中流血了
While she was grumbling, “[Unclear curse”, one of the stones hit her and gashed her head, and blood flowed from the wound.

S.FORM: “wo! mo na to nikcík-i yaken, mo pala-wawat do rala mo a, ”“ay, ji ka mak-aci ang, ji ka mak-aci ang!” koan na no mehakay ori am,
S.TRANSL: “喔，你怎麼這樣打破我的頭！你要死了！” “唉，對不起啦，對不起啦（原：你很可憐吶，你很可憐）” 先生說
“Oh, you really broke my head! You’re dead!” “Sorry, I’m sorry. (lit. You are piteous),” the husband said.

S.FORM: “ananay, mo ka-zisaw” to rana lávi o mavakes ori am, to rana ma-la-layo o mavakes ori.
S.TRANSL: “痛死我了，可惡！” 女的痛哭跑走了
“Ow, that hurts, you moron!” the woman started crying and ran away.

S.FORM: “a ya ma-ngay do wajin ori?”,
S.TRANSL: “ ，她要去哪裡啊”
“Uhh, where is she going?”

S.FORM: am-ian rana do k-anito-an am, om-oli rana.
S.TRANSL: 她一直走到墳場，然後就轉回家去了
She kept going to the graveyards. Afterwards, she went home.

S.FORM: “ji ko rana ngap-a o aro a keytan ito” koan na am, kozong-en na pa ori no mehakay o aro a keytan a. ka-apid na jia.
S.TRANSL: 他想“啊喲，那些山芋怎麼可以不拿了呢？” 於是又回頭去把山芋裝網袋，然後揹回家去
He thought, “Will I just leave the mountain taro there?” He went back to pick them up, put them in a bag, and carried them home.

S.FORM: maka-ranes rana do ili o mavakes ori am, pi-ka-kasa-en na rana (o pzapzatan na), a g-om-cin a ma-ngay Jiayo.
S.TRANSL: 女的到了村莊以後，就開始收拾（她的東西），準備離婚要回椰油村去
Once the woman got to the village, she started to pack [her stuff and prepared to get a divorce to return to Jiayo.

S.FORM: ma-níring o iciaroa na ori am, “yo yo yo” koan na si apen ito, ta yan-an na no nang a.
S.TRANSL: 她的公公照顧著小孫子，嘴裡“唷唷唷” 的哄孫子睡覺；那孫子就是現在的si apen XXX
Her father-in-law si apen something or other was at home taking care of their son, and he was just putting their son to sleep.

S.FORM: “kamo rana ni-m-oli, manga anak ko?” koan na am, to na niri-siríng-i sia.
S.TRANSL: 那老人家說“孩子，你們回來了？” 她理都不理哩
“Child, you are back?” She didn’t even speak.

S.FORM: “a ka ma-ngay jino, mo ka-kedked?” to na nir-sirng-i sia.
S.TRANSL: “親愛的，你要去哪裡？” 她仍然不理公公
“Dear, where are you going?” She still didn’t acknowledge his presence.

S.FORM: to na rana ngáp-a o pzapzatan na, ma-lotoy pa ori a, ma-la-la-layo rana ori a.
S.TRANSL: 她拿了東西就往外跑了，她還是個孕婦呢
The pregnant wife took her stuff and ran.

S.FORM: ma-sínmo na no mehakay ori am, “a ka ma-ngay do wajin?” “mo ka-kma si mina ama mo”,
S.TRANSL: 此時，剛好被趕回家的先生遇上，“你要去哪裡？” “ ，去死啦，你”
On the road she met her husband. “Where are you going?” “Oh, go to hell!”

S.FORM: “a ji ko rana ngoli-an ya, kongo-en ko so wajin o aro a keytan ya?” ori o ni-ka-rahet na no mehakay ori a.
S.TRANSL: 先生也煩惱他揹的山芋，“唉，這些山芋怎麼辦？難道就這樣（揹著）不拿回家嗎？”
The man, on the other hand, was still troubled by what to do with the taro, thinking, “What about the taro? I should take it home.”

S.FORM: karaan na am, “na, i-oli ko pa” koan na am, to na rana ngolí-an o keytan ori a, aong-en na rana ori a.
S.TRANSL: “算了，還是先把山芋揹回家好了” ，然後再回頭去追太太
“I’ll take (the taro) home first.” After he took the taro home, he again went to chase his wife.

S.FORM: “a mo ni-kongo si ina na ni Apo?” koan na no rako a ra-rakeh.
S.TRANSL: “你把孫子的媽怎麼了？” 老人家說
“What did you do to my grandson’s mother? the old man asked.

S.FORM: “a ya ko ni-kongo, a”, “a ya na to pi-ka-kasa-i so pzapzatan na, a na ka-ngay rana?”
S.TRANSL: “我哪有對她怎麼樣， ”，“那她為什麼要收拾東西走人呢？”
“I didn’t do anything, ”“Then why did she take her stuff and leave?”

S.FORM: “a ya ko ni-kongo?” ji na rana 要管-a o rako a ra-rakeh a niapoan na ori a, karaan am, ma-la-layo rana mi na aong-en a.
S.TRANSL: “我哪有對她怎麼樣？” 後來他也不管他的父親大人了，轉身又跑去追太太了
“I didn’t do anything!” He didn’t have time to argue with his father, and went after his wife.

S.FORM: am-ian do Jirakoaarang ori am, rakep-en na no mehakay a.
S.TRANSL: 一直跑到了Jirakoaarang時，才追上了太太，並且抓著她
He kept on running until he got to Jirakoaarang where he caught hold of her.

S.FORM: “m-oli ta rana, a ikong, to ka angay do ya ma-hep rana ito?”
S.TRANSL: 說“走啦，我們回家吧，天色已這麼暗了，你（孕婦）怎麼可以去（走夜路）”
He said, “Let’s go home, for it is late. How can we let you walk in the dark while you are pregnant?”

S.FORM: “ta mo aong-an jiaken, mo pala-ka-kan-i no anito, ji ko rana toda angay do Jiayo a, ji ko a-gcin” koan na
S.TRANSL: “回你個鬼呀，你幹嘛來追我？我要回椰油村去啦，我要離婚”
“Go back, my foot! Why did you come after me? I’m going back to Jiayo, and I want a divorce.”

S.FORM: mi-pal-palcing sira ori am, mi-mingi-mingit sira ori a,
S.TRANSL: 他們就在路上拉來拉去，扯來扯去的
They started a pulling contest in the middle of the road.

S.FORM: “mi ta rana do Jiranmilek” koan na, “a ji ko angay do Jiayo a,
S.TRANSL: 他說“我們回去東清村啦” ，她說“我要去椰油村 ”
“Let’s go back to Jiranmilek,” the man said. “I want to go back to Jiayo”

S.FORM: “a ji ka agay, ta ya ji a-hep rana”, “a ji ko angay Jiayo.”
S.TRANSL: “晚上了，你就別去了” ，“我一定要去椰油村， ”
“It’s late. Don’t go.” “I have to get to Jiayo”

S.FORM: “a ma-kongo inio ya, manga anak ko ang, an?” “ikongo na to ’oya-i nimo no no nia?” “mak-asi si ina na ni apo” koan na no Ivalino a.
S.TRANSL: “孩子們，你們怎麼了？啊？” “他為什麼罵你呢？” “好了，你就可憐孫子的媽吧” ，那個野銀村民說
“What happened, children? Huh?” “Why is he scolding you?” “Stop scolding the son’s mother because she is already troubled enough,” said the person from Ivalino.

S.FORM: “a mo y-ai, mo pala-ka-kan-i no anito a, mo paci-zavoz, mo ka-liman” koan na no mehakay ori a.
S.TRANSL: “你要死啦，你來做什麼，攪什麼局啊？” 男的說
“You idiot, why are you interrupting? Move it,” the husband said.

S.FORM: “a ma-kongo imo ya? mak-asi si ina na ni apo a mo ngi-ngingit-en a ya ma-lotoy ito, an? mi-li-liman sira inio ya?, mi-li-liman sira o ya” koan na,
S.TRANSL: “你是怎麼了嘛，啊，孫子的媽有孕在身呢，你怎麼這樣對她拉扯，她這樣很可憐呢？你們怎麼可以打架呢？ 打架,.”
“What happened? How can you pull her like that? She is pregnant with your son and you can’t sympathize with her? Do you really like to fight that much?”

S.FORM: “a ji abo, mo Maran a”,
S.TRANSL: “沒事啦，大叔”
“Nothing is happening, Uncle.”

S.FORM: 不好意思 rana sira mi-mingi-mingit dang am, to rana ngoli sira ori a mi-ehza am.
S.TRANSL: 人家看他們拉拉扯扯的，他們也覺得尷尬，於是就一起回家去了
They felt embarrassed that someone else saw them fighting, so they went home together.

S.FORM: i-pa-cita na rana sicia-ra-rakeh na rana ya ori am, ya ji a-ráko o kozad na do jia, ji akay mo icialaw, ori rana.
S.TRANSL: 如今她老了，有時候會給人看她（頭上？）的疤痕，還滿大的；那就是你祖父的傑作。我就講到這裡完了
Now she is old. She occasionally shows where your grandfather hit her years ago. The scar is actually still there and is fairly large. This is the end of my story.

S.FORM: am-ian do likey a ayo am, “ya rana to ngóli ori?” to na aong-a am,
S.TRANSL: 她走到小河邊時，男的想“難道她要回家了嗎？” 於是就追過去
She kept going to the stream, and the man thought, “Does she want to go home?” and ran after her.

S.FORM: to na a-cita no akmi soma-s-om-ágpian so ciri-ciring am, a si Laloay koan da a Ivalino.
S.TRANSL: 就在這時，正好有一個野銀村民經過，他是那種講話會結巴的那種人，人稱他是si Laloay，正好遇見他們在拉扯的情形
A person from Ivalino saw the fight going on. This person was si Laloay, and he was a person with a lisp.

S.FORM: “beken, am-ian so maci-li-liman do mavakes? ya ma-lotoy ito a, ji mak-asi ito? a ikey-kóngo o akma jimo ya? cia rana, oli rana an, maka-vava an” koan na no Ivalino ori a.
S.TRANSL: “不，哪有[男人 跟女人打架的，何況她是個孕婦，這麼可憐。你像話嗎？你，好了，回家吧，不可以這樣” ，那個野銀村民說

“No, I can see that you are fighting. Never does a man fight with a woman, especially when she is pregnant. Don’t you pity her? This is totally not right, so go on home and stop fighting,” the person from Ivalino said.

S.FORM: ori o i-panci da no ra-rakeh nokakoa, “ji kamo mi-awawa no vey-veysen am, ipeypangan an, ta t-om-akatakaw ka-to maka-nao-an sira am”.
S.TRANSL: 這就是古時候老人家講的，“不要拿石頭或刀子對人作投或刺勢，你怎知道，你就真的弄傷了對方”
This is what the elders used to say, “Don’t aim stones or knives at somebody, for one day there will be an accident.”
